title: Broken: Importing and Exporting SequenceLabeling projects with relations
body:
How to reproduce the behaviour
---------
<!-- Before submitting an issue, make sure to check the docs and closed issues and FAQ to see if any of the solutions work for you. https://github.com/doccano/doccano/wiki/Frequently-Asked-Questions -->

<!-- Include a code example or the steps that led to the problem. Please try to be as specific as possible. -->

Your Environment
---------
<!-- Include details of your environment.-->
*   Operating System: Dockeer
*   Python Version Used: 3.8
*   When you install doccano: 11/1/22
*   How did you install doccano (Heroku button etc): docker-compose

I observed issues with the UI and interacting with relation labels. I am able create a relation label between two span labels in the UI, however the relation array get exported empty when going through the Export Dataset -> JSONL(relation) path. Furthermore, issues occur when trying to import relations as well. The import dataset flow only takes one "Column Label" field. When that is set to label, all of the span label and relation label info are uploaded as metadata. 

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/81196676/199328801-c98d3693-ff8f-45b3-80a3-7d916075ec56.png)

If the "Column Label" field is set to "entities" the span labels are imported and only the relation label data is uploaded as metadata. 

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/81196676/199329062-26b1ea53-8b03-464d-932e-15e0b0e83061.png)

The first goal would be that the export process, exports in the format displayed when you select the JSONL(relation) option from Export Dataset.

ie.

```
{
    "text": "Google was founded on September 4, 1998, by Larry Page and Sergey Brin.",
    "entities": [
        {
            "id": 0,
            "start_offset": 0,
            "end_offset": 6,
            "label": "ORG"
        },
        {
            "id": 1,
            "start_offset": 22,
            "end_offset": 39,
            "label": "DATE"
        },
        {
            "id": 2,
            "start_offset": 44,
            "end_offset": 54,
            "label": "PERSON"
        },
        {
            "id": 3,
            "start_offset": 59,
            "end_offset": 70,
            "label": "PERSON"
        }
    ],
    "relations": [
        {
            "id": 0,
            "from_id": 0,
            "to_id": 1,
            "type": "foundedAt"
        },
        {
            "id": 1,
            "from_id": 0,
            "to_id": 2,
            "type": "foundedBy"
        },
        {
            "id": 2,
            "from_id": 0,
            "to_id": 3,
            "type": "foundedBy"
        }
    ]
}
```

The second goal would be the ability to upload span labels and relation labels. Basically, Import Dataset should work with the Export Dataset -> JSONL(relation) results. I'll include a JSONL testing file for imports.

[relation_import_sample.zip](https://github.com/doccano/doccano/files/9913661/relation_import_sample.zip)

title: images to label doesn't show after changing port number (docker-compose)
body:
How to reproduce the problem
---------
Hi!
I want to set port number 8910 for docker-compose, instead of 80
so I have changed port binding from `80:8080` to `8910:8080` in `docker-compose.prod.yml/nginx/ports`

Port have been changed successfully and I can access to doccano. 
But, images are not displayed when I do image labeling task(Image Captioning, Object Detection, Segmentation, Image Classification).

I got this error message in browser console
``` 
GET http://127.0.0.1/media/Z8XBdszx/QRweasa net::ERR_CONNECTION_REFUSED
```
But when I send a request with changed port `http://127.0.0.1:8910/media/Z8XBdszx/QRweasa`, I can get a image

I have checked lots of issues, but I can't get a solution.
Then, I found a code `expose 80` in line 13, [doccano/doccano:frontend](https://hub.docker.com/layers/doccano/doccano/frontend/images/sha256-4374af19b1f4c6879f40862976766cd2fb76884bec77d0c73693b837584f97c7?context=explore)

I think carefully, this is the reason why url has been mapped with default port(:80), even I changed the port 8910. 
which so, I can't get images

I am not able to fix the code futher more this.
I would be glad if you could help.
thank you.

Your Environment
---------
<!-- Include details of your environment.-->
*   Operating System: Windows 11 / ubuntu (same issue)
*   Python Version Used: 3.9
*   When you install doccano: 26/10/2022
*   How did you install doccano (Heroku button etc): Docker compose

title: Excel import on text classification project
body: Hi! I am trying to upload excel document to doccano set up in docker, but I am receiving this error: Not sure if this is something we are doing wrong, or anything environment related, or something else. Went over the code to try to find the issue and my first guess would be that xlsx file is recognized as zip file, but on the other hand `ENABLE_FILE_TYPE_CHECK` is set to False and I cannot find phrase `is not supported for read` anywhere in code base, so its most probably something else. Your Environment --------- Docker compose file (postgres is run as a separate docker instance): ``` # Note: Managed by Ansible services: doccano: image: doccano/doccano env_file: - .env environment: ADMIN_USERNAME: "${ADMIN_USERNAME}" ADMIN_PASSWORD: "${ADMIN_PASSWORD}" ADMIN_EMAIL: ${ADMIN_EMAIL} CELERY_BROKER_URL: "amqp://${RABBITMQ_DEFAULT_USER}:${RABBITMQ_DEFAULT_PASS}@rabbitmq" DATABASE_URL: "postgres://${POSTGRES_USER}:${POSTGRES_PASSWORD}@postgres:5432/${POSTGRES_DB}?sslmode=disable" ALLOW_SIGNUP: "False" DEBUG: "False" DJANGO_SETTINGS_MODULE: "config.settings.production" SESSION_COOKIE_SECURE: "True" CSRF_COOKIE_SECURE: "True" CSRF_TRUSTED_ORIGINS: "https://${DOCCANO_DOMAIN_NAME}" volumes: - ./media:/doccano/backend/media - ./static:/doccano/backend/staticfiles - ./tmp_file:/doccano/backend/filepond-temp-uploads networks: - default ports: - 8080:8080 - 8000:8000 depends_on: - celery celery: image: doccano/doccano env_file: - .env volumes: - ./media:/doccano/backend/media - ./tmp_file:/doccano/backend/filepond-temp-uploads entrypoint: ["celery", "--app=config", "worker", "--loglevel=info", "--pool=solo"] environment: PYTHONUNBUFFERED: "1" CELERY_BROKER_URL: "amqp://${RABBITMQ_DEFAULT_USER}:${RABBITMQ_DEFAULT_PASS}@rabbitmq" DATABASE_URL: "postgres://${POSTGRES_USER}:${POSTGRES_PASSWORD}@postgres:5432/${POSTGRES_DB}?sslmode=disable" DJANGO_SETTINGS_MODULE: "config.settings.production" networks: - default depends_on: - rabbitmq rabbitmq: image: rabbitmq:3.8-alpine env_file: - .env environment: RABBITMQ_DEFAULT_USER: "${RABBITMQ_DEFAULT_USER}" RABBITMQ_DEFAULT_PASS: "${RABBITMQ_DEFAULT_PASS}" networks: - default ports: - 5672:5672 networks: default: external: true name: linguistics_network ```

title: Cannot access Django admin panel in a Heroku deployment
body:
How to reproduce the behaviour
---------
The FAQ describes how to [create a user via the Django admin panel](https://github.com/doccano/doccano/blob/master/docs/faq.md#how-to-create-a-user) for a locally hosted Doccano. When run locally, I have no problem to reach the admin panel on `http://localhost:8000/admin/`, in Heroku however it is not working.

I have tried to reach it on
- `https://mydeployment.herokuapp.com/admin/`
- `https://mydeployment.herokuapp.com/admin/login`
- `https://mydeployment.herokuapp.com/admin/login/`
- `http://mydeployment.herokuapp.com/admin/`

Those urls all result in a `500 Internal Server Error`.
Am I missing something here, or is this perhaps a bug?

Your Environment
---------
<!-- Include details of your environment. -->

*   Operating System: -
*   Python Version Used: -
*   When did you install doccano: A few days ago
*   How did you install doccano (Heroku button etc): Heroku button

```
Operating System: CentOS Linux 7 (Core)
Kernel: Linux 3.10.0-1160.45.1.el7.x86_64
Architecture: x86-64
```

- **Python version**:  Python 3.9.5

### Describe the problem

My dataset has existing labels for a sequence labeling task. In this annotation scenario, the annotators are meant to verify the existing labels, and propose new ones. 

Observed: the UI does not show the existing labels. 

Expected: The UI does show them. 

I can reproduce this problem on doccano 1.5. 

On older versions, it seems to work OK. E.g., on 1.4.1 the pre-existing labels are shown. 

I have reproduced this with both pip and docker. For docker, I am comparing the `doccano/doccano:1.5` image with `doccano/doccano:1.4.1` image. 



### Source code / logs

I can reproduce the problem with the following dataset  (the sample from the UI):

```
{"text": "EU rejects German call to boycott British lamb.", "label": [ [0, 2, "ORG"]]}
{"text": "Peter Blackburn", "label": [ [0, 15, "PERSON"] ]}
{"text": "President Obama", "label": [ [10, 15, "PERSON"] ]}
```

When the data set is loaded into version 1.4.1, the labels are shown. In 1.5, they are not shown.

title: Frontend in docker-compose dev installation does not work in v1.5.0
body:
How to reproduce the behaviour
---------

`doccano-frontend-1` container exits after installing the dev environment with `docker-compose -f docker-compose.dev.yml --env-file ./config/.env.example up` with the following error message:

I got this problem only for doccano `v1.5.0`.

title: Unable to tag selected text in collab mode
body:
### Environment 
*   Operating System: Linux - Alpine 3.11
*   Python Version Used: 3.8.6
*   When you install doccano: July 14, 2021
*   How did you install doccano (Heroku button etc): one-click setup script provided on GitHub readme 


### The problem
Bug: when attempting to tag text, words/characters about 10-13 characters over end up being tagged, as opposed to the selected text. This issue persists across browsers (Chrome and Safari) and across all of our uploaded documents. When `collaboration` mode is turned on, all team members experience the issue. However, when we turn it off, it begins working perfectly again. Please see video: https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/21316094/136839200-8384dbcb-8b8f-49a5-9ae9-3235be6e6807.mov 

### To reproduce
Reproducible test case: multiple users should tag a particular document, turn collaborative mode on then try tagging that document and see if the text selected is the text that gets tagged.

body:
*   Operating System: macOS Big Sur v: 11.6
*   Python Version Used: 3.6
*   When you install doccano: Version: 1.4.1
*   How did you install doccano (Heroku button etc): via `pip install doccano`

Hi, I faced the problem described [here](https://github.com/doccano/doccano/issues/82), but for **downloading** the data. The `IMPORT_BATCH_SIZE` variable does not impact on downloading process.

To reproduce you need to try download `jsonl` dataset with more than 2k rows (in my case it was sequence labeling) via doccano. I've launch server via:
```
$ doccano init
$ doccano createuser --username admin --password pass
$ doccano webserver --port 8000
```
and then 
```
$ doccano task
```

title: Text not passed to auto labeling REST endpoint
body:
How to reproduce the behaviour
---------
<!-- Before submitting an issue, make sure to check the docs and closed issues and FAQ to see if any of the solutions work for you. https://github.com/doccano/doccano/wiki/Frequently-Asked-Questions -->
Make a Flask (or other service endpoint) and try to use the Custom REST endpoint.
<!--
Include a code example or the steps that led to the problem. Please try to be as specific as possible. -->

When using the auto labeling custom REST endpoint, the text is not passed at all. Running a basic Flask service shows that the only things sent are those specified by me, but not the sample text that needs to be passed. 

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1341193/125325751-ea96ea80-e306-11eb-8f3e-732826fc4fbb.png)
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1341193/125325901-1a45f280-e307-11eb-8883-77c65c059279.png)
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1341193/125325927-1fa33d00-e307-11eb-8038-c17dc02f29a7.png)

I would expect to see "wata" somewhere in there, without it the REST endpoint is entirely useless. I can see that there is a request to "auto-labeling-parameter-testing" that looks like this: 
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1341193/125326066-43ff1980-e307-11eb-8f1c-e92038983acf.png)
and it has the text, but that is not passed when this is semi-redirected to the server.

Your Environment
---------
<!-- Include details of your environment. -->

Latest docker version on Windows.

title: Server returns 500 if task is not yet ready.
body:
How to reproduce the behaviour
---------
Make a POST request to the `projects/{project_id}/download` endpoint to get a task_id for a large (500kb) project. Make a GET request to the same endpoint, with the `taskId` query parameter set to `task_id` you just received. If the download is not yet ready, the server will issue a 500 error, because the corresponding view returns a None.

title: Image Auto-labelling not working
body: How to reproduce the behaviour --------- I wanted to know if the Image auto-labelling is working or not. Text auto-labelling seems to be working using all the 3 - GCP, AWS and Custom Rest API While setting up Image auto labelling using GCP Image label detection I encountered the following error. Same issue with AWS or Custom REST API I think there should be an option to upload a sample Image instead of sample text ( as used in text labelling). title: Exporting only checked annotation always results in an empty zip file
body:
How to reproduce the behaviour
---------
I made a project for text annotation. I can annotate and export the *whole* dataset as well. But whenever I try to export only the checked data, I always get an empty zip file of 22 bytes. There is no code to reproduce this. I am not sure if others are facing this issue as well. But I guess if you have some documents that are checked and annotated and some that are not checked because you want to annotate them later, then when you want to export only the checked documents you get an empty zip file.

Any solution for this?

I am the Project Admin and I am only one working. Everything is running from inside a container.

Your Environment
---------
*   Operating System: Docker on Windows 10
*   Python Version Used: N/A
*   When you install doccano: Today
*   How did you install doccano (Heroku button etc): Docker

----------
Apparently Windows doesn''t support `fcntl`. Therefore nobody that uses Windows can install doccano via pip.

title: TemplateDoesNotExist Error on start from README instructions

```
doccano init

doccano webserver --port 8000
```

```
doccano task
```

title: Export dataset adds meta field only for the documents with labels
body:
How to reproduce the behaviour
---------
<!-- Before submitting an issue, make sure to check the docs and closed issues and FAQ to see if any of the solutions work for you. https://github.com/doccano/doccano/wiki/Frequently-Asked-Questions -->
1. Create a dataset of 2 documents with a meta field
2. Add a label to only one document
3. Export the dataset

As a result, the meta field will be present only for the document with a label. However, it's a common situation when some documents don't have any labels. And it's a very good practice to feet models with documents with and without labels to get a good perf.  And the meta field is the only way to do the relation between the documents extracted from the doccano and the original dataset. 

Another interesting point is that if you add the label for both documents, all of them will have the meta field. And then if you remove labels and run the export again, this field disappears 

<!-- Include a code example or the steps that led to the problem. Please try to be as specific as possible. -->

Your Environment
---------
<!-- Include details of your environment.-->
Run directly in your docker environment

title: Unreachable EC2 after AWS one-click deployment
body:
When deploying to AWS with one-click deployment to a `t2.micro` EC2, instance never seems to get available, at least within "reasonable" time (< 60 minutes).
Specifically, its public IP/DNS does not answer neither ping, SSH, or HTTP.

Is `t2.small` the minimal requirement?
The CloudFormation template rather seems to suggests that `t2.micro` is also valid.

Any thoughts on that?

Possibly related: https://github.com/doccano/doccano/issues/300 and https://github.com/doccano/doccano/issues/1061.

title: Wrong variable used in the Gcloud One-click Deployment Script
body:
How to reproduce the behaviour
---------
<!-- Before submitting an issue, make sure to check the docs and closed issues and FAQ to see if any of the solutions work for you. https://github.com/doccano/doccano/wiki/Frequently-Asked-Questions -->

<!-- Include a code example or the steps that led to the problem. Please try to be as specific as possible. -->
Hello, 

I tried to use the Gcloud One-click Deployment script. The deployment worked correctly but I couldn't login with the admin account set in the environment variable. I checked in the database and saw that were not created user.
I restarted with DEBUG mode and saw this error: 
```
Creating admin`.
CommandError: Enter a valid email address.
```

Thus, I searched in the repository code and found no mention of environment variable `ADMIN_CONTACT_EMAIL` (defined in the Google Cloud Run parameters) except in 2 specific Heroku files. 
So, I tried by renaming `ADMIN_CONTACT_EMAIL` to `ADMIN_EMAIL` directly in the Google Cloud Run parameters.

I restarted with DEBUG mode and saw this in the logs: 
```
Creating admin`.
Superuser created successfully.
```

Finally, I tried to login and everything was working correctly.

This issue is probably linked with the same problem that I had: https://github.com/doccano/doccano/issues/1140.

Possible correction to do
-------
- Change in the Gcloud One-click Deployment Script from `ADMIN_CONTACT_EMAIL` to `ADMIN_EMAIL` (but I don't know where this environment variable is defined in this repository)


Your Environment
---------
<!-- Include details of your environment.-->
*   Operating System: /
*   Python Version Used: /
*   When you install doccano: 4th of May 2021
*   How did you install doccano (Heroku button etc): Gcloud One-Click Deployment

title: After Quick Deploy on Heroku, App crash due to sqlalchemy
body:
How to reproduce the behaviour
---------
Start the quick deploy to heroku
Wait for successful build and deploy
Open app and wait for crash.

**Logs** 
`sqlalchemy.exc.NoSuchModuleError: Can't load plugin: sqlalchemy.dialects:postgres`
 `celery crashed`
`Process exited with status 12021-04-23T17:02:29.297622+00:00 heroku[web.1]: State changed from up to crashed`

Apparently versions of SQLAlchemy 1.4+ require postgresql:// and do not accept postgre:// anymore.

The DATABASE_URL start with postgres:// after deployment on heroku

Your Environment
---------
Installed with the deploy to heroku from doccano's home page, built from Dockerfile.
SQLAlchemy was 1.4.7

title: [Bug report] With arrow keys, non-valid document ids can be reached
body:
Annotate a dataset (text classification was tested) and flip between documents using the arrow keys. 

Go to report 1, left arrow icons are grayed out, and go left using arrow key, first accessing document ID 0, which shouldn't exist. Here, the arrow icons are accessible to click again. Go left again wither with arrow icon or left key, accessing document ID -1. At this point, a 404 is thrown and the right arrow key won't bring you back to valid documents (for obvious reasons).

Similar behavior can be found at the max document ID. Go to last document in dataset. Right arrows are grayed out. Go right with key to access non-valid document id. The page becomes blank and user cannot use keys anymore to go back.

*   Operating System: macOS 
*   Browser: Chrome 89.0.4389.90

title: [Bug report] Shortcut keys not working for text classification
body:
First of all, thanks for a great product!

I can't get the shortcut keys for project type DocumentClassification to work. It works fine however for a SequenceLabeling project. I've tried several sets of numbers and letters, marking different things in UI -- no response. From what I can tell, there are no console messages (Chrome). I've tried multiple browsers (listed below), and a colleague has reproduced the problem on a different OS (listed below).

To reproduce the problem
--------------------------
Create a standard DocumentClassification project, upload a minimal dataset, create two arbitrary labels with shortcuts. Start annotation and watch the shortcuts fail.

Environment
------------
The following combinations have been tested:
*    macOS Catalina (10.15.7) + Chrome (89.0.4389.90)
*    macOS Catalina (10.15.7) + Firefox (86.0.1 (64-bit))
*    macOS Catalina (10.15.7) + Safari (14.0)
*    Ubuntu 18.04 + Firefox (86.0 (64-bit))


- Python Version Used: 3.8.6 (container), 3.8.2 (macOS)
- When you install doccano: current master: 979f8720444bf8a933d2450e60874bd15aafd4b0 (v1.2.2)
- How did you install doccano (Heroku button etc): docker-compose (README.md instructions)
- Using dev container

title: Okta OIDC social login is not available
body:
# Problem

The [documentation for activating Okta OIDC social authentication](https://doccano.github.io/doccano/advanced/oauth2_settings/#openidconnect) indicates that when I set the three following environment variables, the login screen will have an option to authenticate using Okta OIDC:
1. `OAUTH_OKTA_OPENIDCONNECT_KEY`
2. `OAUTH_OKTA_OPENIDCONNECT_SECRET`
3. `OAUTH_OKTA_OPENIDCONNECT_API_URL`

This is not happening.

# How to reproduce the behaviour
1. Run `doccano:1.2.1` image with the following command:
```bash
docker run --rm --interactive --tty
    --env SECRET_KEY=REDACTED \
    --env ADMIN_EMAIL=noreply@example.com \
    --env ADMIN_PASSWORD=REDACTED \
    --env ADMIN_USERNAME=admin \
    --env OAUTH_OKTA_OPENIDCONNECT_KEY=REDACTED \
    --env OAUTH_OKTA_OPENIDCONNECT_SECRET=REDACTED \
    --env OAUTH_OKTA_OPENIDCONNECT_API_URL=https://my-identity.okta.com/api \
    --publish 8000:8000 \
    doccano/doccano:1.2.1
```
2. Navigate to `doccano` in your browser at: http://locahost:8000
3. Select the "login" button at the top-right of the page

# Expected behavior
I expect to see the "Login with Okta" option as depicted in [this image](https://doccano.github.io/doccano/images/oauth/okta_oauth_login_page.png)

# Actual behavior
I end up seeing the same login screen/options that I get when I do not configure Okta OIDC social authentication.

# My environment
* I am running the `doccano/doccano:1.2.1` Docker image
* I am running behind a enterprise firewall with a SSL packet inspection and enterprise certificate authority. Other applications can perform Okta OIDC SSO in this environment, but app eventually needs to recognize system installed trusted CA chain. I do not expect this to be the source of this problem _before we actually submit login credentials_, however - there is a possibility.
* `docker-desktop` v20.10.5 on Windows 10
* Above command issued from WSL version 1, running WSL (version 1 with Ubuntu 18.04 LTS) bash:
```bash
$ uname -a
Linux MY-PC 4.4.0-18362-Microsoft #1049-Microsoft Thu Aug 14 12:01:00 PST 2020 x86_64 x86_64 x86_64 GNU/Linux
```

title: Text field missing / Costum Rest Api for Auto-Labelling
body:
How to reproduce the behaviour
---------
When sending (Testing) the Post request inside the creation of a costum rest api service for auto-labelling the request payload (which goes to doccano/django) looks like this:
```
{
  "id": 99999,
  "model_name": "CustomRESTRequestModel",
  "model_attrs": {
    "url": "http://0.0.0.0:5001/process-single/",
    "method": "POST",
    "params": {},
    "headers": {},
    "body": { "model": "models/model-best" }
  },
  "template": "",
  "label_mapping": {},
  "text": "Example Text"
}
```
My Problem/Question
---
I suppose this is the request which is being send to Django to create a model instance which is used to communicate with my costum rest api.
Somehow, when calling my api using doccano, the received json does only inlcude `{ "model": "models/model-best" }`. Shouldn't `"text": "Example Text"` also be in there? What am I missing?

*   Operating System: Ubuntu
*   Python Version Used: 3.8
*   How did you install doccano (Heroku button etc): Docker

title: One click deployment to Heroku not working
body:
Trying to install Doccano via the Heroku button, with the following parameters:

- **REGION:** United States
- **ALLOW_SIGNUP:** True
- **DEBUG:** False

The error appears at "Run scripts & scale dynos":

title: sh: 0: Can't open tools/heroku.sh
body: sh: 0: Can't open tools/heroku.sh

title: Azure one click deployment: container was not able to startup
body:
I tried one-click deployment to deploy doccano in Azure. I had a problem with creating new SendGrid account (because I already had one) so I modified template a little bit: I removed "send grid creation" step from template and replaced send-grid related parameters with existing value (smpt, api key and etc).

But application not starting. Logs says that container was not able to startup because of following error:

2021-01-14T14:55:13.515214058Z Making staticfiles
2021-01-14T14:55:13.515247858Z Executing collectstatic
2021-01-14T14:55:13.657481952Z python: can't open file 'manage.py': [Errno 2] No such file or directory

Any idea how this can be fixed?

title: Can annotate while logged in administration protal
body:
How to reproduce the behaviour
---------

1.  Login to a user other than admin
2. Login to administration portal using admin
3. Go to previous user and try annotating

Your Environment
---------
*   Operating System: Mac and Chrome
*   Python Version Used: 3.7
*   When you install doccano: 1 month ago
*   How did you install doccano (Heroku button etc): AWS ec2

Admin portal,

title: Can't login to Doccano using any other user than admin while loggin into the user portal
body:
How to reproduce the behaviour
---------

I open two tabs on a browser. On first browser I Login using admin credentials on the Django Administration portal. Now I created a new user. Using this new user credentials if I login to doccano portal while already logged in to the Admin portal, it fails to login. 

I'm required to logout from the Django Administration portal and then only I can login using the new credentials.

Your Environment
---------
*   Operating System: Mac and Chrome
*   Python Version Used: 3.7
*   When you install doccano: 1 month ago
*   How did you install doccano (Heroku button etc): Our own ec2

Django Administration portal:
![Screenshot 2021-01-13 at 16 05 33](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/11743805/104442799-98754680-55bb-11eb-9fd9-3d2eb8e9051e.jpg)

At the same time, doccano portal,
![Screenshot 2021-01-13 at 16 05 16](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/11743805/104442830-a2974500-55bb-11eb-8cff-d880a610119c.jpg)

title: Can't reset doccano environment
body:
<!-- Before submitting an issue, make sure to check the docs and closed issues and FAQ to see if any of the solutions work for you. https://github.com/doccano/doccano/wiki/Frequently-Asked-Questions -->

I installed doccano on linux machine, but due to some mis-operation, I stopped the server before first login.

Since then, I cannot login to the system correctly. I used "admin" and "password", but cannot log in.
After I started the server from commandline, I get the following error:
-----------------------------------
No migrations to apply.
  Your models have changes that are not yet reflected in a migration, and so won't be applied.
  Run 'manage.py makemigrations' to make new migrations, and then re-run 'manage.py migrate' to apply them.

-----------------------------------

I uninstall and reinstall the package, but the problem remains the same, it looks that some settings are kept there, not a really fresh install. 

My question:
(1) any way to fix this to login to it?
(2) any way to really fresh install everything?
Thank you for your help in advance.

Best

title: Cannot login to default admin account
body:
After deploying Doccano, I can't login to the default admin account. The server returns "Wrong password or username" message. I tried both installing with Heroku button and installing docker or docker-compose on AWS Linux / AWS Ubuntu and receive the same error log below. It seems related to azuread_tenant.py. 


<!-- Before submitting an issue, make sure to check the docs and closed issues and FAQ to see if any of the solutions work for you. https://github.com/doccano/doccano/wiki/Frequently-Asked-Questions -->

---------
I tried both installing with Heroku button and installing docker or docker-compose on AWS Linux.

title: Installation via docker-compose fails due to python version conflicts (3.6 vs 3.8 required)
body:
<!-- Before submitting an issue, make sure to check the docs and closed issues and FAQ to see if any of the solutions work for you. https://github.com/doccano/doccano/wiki/Frequently-Asked-Questions -->

Hello, 
First, thank you for developing and maintaining Doccano, which is a super-useful ressource. 

When trying to install the latest version of doccano via the docker-compose installation, I ran in a bug which forces the backend to exit, due to a python version conflict. 

I first did a canonical docker + docker compose installation (following docker documentation), then, following Doccano documentation :  

```bash
git clone https://github.com/doccano/doccano.git
cd doccano
docker-compose -f docker-compose.prod.yml up
```
I ran into this error: 

```bash
Starting doccano_postgres_1 ... done
Starting doccano_frontend_1 ... done

backend_1   |     self._setup(name)
backend_1   |   File "/usr/lib/python3.6/site-packages/django/conf/__init__.py", line 66, in _setup
backend_1   |     self._wrapped = Settings(settings_module)
backend_1   |   File "/usr/lib/python3.6/site-packages/django/conf/__init__.py", line 157, in __init__
backend_1   |     mod = importlib.import_module(self.SETTINGS_MODULE)
backend_1   |   File "/usr/lib/python3.6/importlib/__init__.py", line 126, in import_module
backend_1   |     return _bootstrap._gcd_import(name[level:], package, level)
backend_1   |   File "<frozen importlib._bootstrap>", line 994, in _gcd_import
backend_1   |   File "<frozen importlib._bootstrap>", line 971, in _find_and_load
backend_1   |   File "<frozen importlib._bootstrap>", line 955, in _find_and_load_unlocked
backend_1   |   File "<frozen importlib._bootstrap>", line 665, in _load_unlocked

```
It seems like the python version installed by docker was python 3.6, where, when I checked the main Dockerfile ([doccano/Dockerfile](https://github.com/doccano/doccano/blob/master/Dockerfile)), it should be python 3.8.6 (and manage.py syntax error suggests it is python 3.8). 

Might it be the alpine 3.9.6 version of [doccano/app/Dockerfile](https://github.com/doccano/doccano/blob/master/app/Dockerfile) which has python 3.6.9 by default? ( https://pkgs.alpinelinux.org/package/v3.9/main/x86_64/python3 )

Thank you in advance!

title: Unable to import CoNLL files
body:
Hi there,

Before I start, I would like to thank you for creating and open sourcing such a fabulous annotation tool! 

Now, I have no issues with uploading plain text files. My issue is with uploading conll files. I tried a few datasets (https://github.com/juand-r/entity-recognition-datasets/blob/master/data/wikigold/CONLL-format/data/wikigold.conll.txt and https://deepai.org/dataset/conll-2003-english) but the error prompt comes back with "The file could not be uploaded. Maybe invalid format. Please check available formats carefully." 
I also tried reducing the dataset to less than 100 sentences and also changed the file type to .conll but it still gives me the same error. Possible to point me in the right direction to upload these files?

Thank you!

Your Environment
*   Operating System: Ubuntu 20.04
*   Python Version Used: Python 3.8.5
*   When you install doccano: 14th November
*   How did you install doccano (Heroku button etc): docker-compose

title: Create project failed with error message "Bad Request"

---------
I ran Doccano simply by using the following command:

```
git clone https://github.com/doccano/doccano.git
cd doccano
docker-compose -f docker-compose.prod.yml up
```

I logged in as Administrator to http://0.0.0.0/ and tried to create a new project of type `sequence to sequence`.
I got the following error message:

When looking on the error log of the `backend` docker, I've noticed the following mesage:
```
Bad Request: /v1/projects
```

In addition, when I look on the `Network` tab inside the Chrome debugger, I see that when I try to create a project, I get the following error: `resourcetype: "This field is required"` from the request `projects`.

*   Python Version Used: I used Docker only

Container xxxxxxxxxxx  couldn't be started: Logs = 2020-09-02T06:20:16.887355503Z Operations to perform:
2020-09-02T06:20:16.887396106Z   Apply all migrations: admin, api, auth, authtoken, contenttypes, sessions, social_django

2020-09-02T06:20:16.887417707Z   Run 'manage.py makemigrations' to make new migrations, and then re-run 'manage.py migrate' to apply them.
2020-09-02T06:20:23.362115634Z Traceback (most recent call last):
2020-09-02T06:20:23.362139736Z   File "/usr/local/lib/python3.6/site-packages/django/db/backends/utils.py", line 85, in _execute
2020-09-02T06:20:23.362145936Z     return self.cursor.execute(sql, params)
2020-09-02T06:20:23.362151036Z psycopg2.IntegrityError: duplicate key value violates unique constraint "auth_user_username_key"
2020-09-02T06:20:23.362156137Z DETAIL:  Key (username)=(doccanoadmin) already exists.

Your Environment
---------
Azure Deploy

Temp hack to get it working after deployment and for getting existing projects to appear
Goto "Hosted Doccano Azure Web App" -> Configuration -> "ADMIN_USERNAME" -> and make the value empty and that should bypass the above error

Note: I am unsure in all the other places that this "ADMIN_USERNAME" is used so by doing the above, you might end up breaking it in other places

title: restart doccano issue: UNIQUE constraint failed: auth_user.username
body:
I installed doccano in win 10 with docker using the following instruction:
`docker pull doccano/doccano
docker container create --name doccano \
  -e "ADMIN_USERNAME=admin" \
  -e "ADMIN_EMAIL=admin@example.com" \
  -e "ADMIN_PASSWORD=password" \
  -p 8000:8000 doccano/doccano`

I successfully install and login with admin account and guest account.
But,  once I stop doccano with following command:
`docker container stop doccano -t 5`

When I restarted the doccano with following command:
`docker container start doccano`

An error appeared:
`File "/usr/local/lib/python3.6/site-packages/django/db/backends/sqlite3/base.py", line 298, in execute

return Database.Cursor.execute(self, query, params)

django.db.utils.IntegrityError: UNIQUE constraint failed: auth_user.username`

So, is there any mistake I did? how can I fix it?

Environment
---------
<!-- Include details of your environment. -->

*   Operating System: win 10
*   Python Version Used: python 3.7
*   When you install doccano: 2020 July.
*   How did you install doccano (Heroku button etc): I was following the documentation with docker instruction.

title: [bug report] `annotation_approver` cannot see annotator's tags for sequence labeling
body:
How to reproduce the behaviour
---------
Sign in as admin to `localhost/admin` Django backend
Create `user1`, `reviewer1`
Sign out.
Sign in as admin to `localhost` frontend
Add dataset
Add label
Add user1 as annotator
Add reviewer1 as `annotation_approver`
Sign out as admin
Sign in as user1
Annotate
Sign out
Sign in as reviewer1
Click on annotate
-> cannot see any annotations left by other users. toggle approve button on/off and still sees nothing.

Your Environment
---------
<!-- Include details of your environment.-->
*   Operating System: Windows 10, Build 200725
*   Python Version Used:  python3 version defined in `app/Dockerfile`
*   When you install doccano:  fresh pull from 1.0.5 master branch
*   How did you install doccano (Heroku button etc):  `docker-compose -f docker-compose.prod.yml up --build`

title: [Bug report] 400 error on annotation (again)
body:
How to reproduce the behaviour
---------
Seems like #902 is not fixed.

Let we have `Car` and `Pet` labels.

1. Start annotation.
2. Type `Ca` at label selector's text field.
3. Select `Car` by Up/Down keys.
4. Press Enter _(not mouse click!)_.

You get 400 error:
```
backend_1   | Bad Request: /v1/projects/20/docs/26329/annotations
```

Also IMHO we have to clear `Ca` text editor value.

Your Environment
---------

title: Duplicate Documents seen after setting "Randomize Document Order Per User"
body:
Hi,
While setting up a new project, I chose the option "Randomize Document Order Per User". Now when I import the dataset and every user started annotating, we are all seeing duplicate documents in the rows. This did not happen when we didnt select this setting. Even though duplicates are present the number of documents displayed on the page are same as the original no of documents(without duplicates). That means we are losing on some documents that are being replaced with these duplicate documents. 

Just to confirm we have checked and there are no duplicates in the file. So that means the issue is coming from Doccano and only when we are chosing the above mentioned setting.

We are currently using Doccano through deployment on Azure.

Any help is appreciated.
Thanks!

title: 404 page and subsequent redirect behaves as if user is not authenticated
body:
How to reproduce the behaviour
---------
After logging in, if I produce an error (e.g. go to 127.0.0.1:3000/error) which sends me the 404 page, the header behaves as if I am not authenticated. When I press on the link to redirected to the original home page, it still behaves as if I am no longer signed in. However when I put in: 127.0.0.1:3000/projects, it behaves as if I am still authenticated.

Expected behavior would be the error page preserving the fact that I am still authenticated and when redirected, for the home page to have the header behave as if I am still authenticated, with the links to Projects and ability to Logout.

![Screenshot from 2020-07-19 23-03-29](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/64808267/87895705-1cd37c00-ca14-11ea-810d-fbe0ebd78c4c.png)

title: Checkpoint keeps only last project
body:
How to reproduce the behaviour
---------

It seems that the checkpoint keeps only the page of the last project visited. I suppose the correct behavior would be keep the information from all projects.

The cause must be that sometimes a new checkpoint is created when a page is saved/updated for one project, as you can see the following example (see FilterButtom.vue, DocumentList.vue and pagination.js):

```
const checkpoint = {}
checkpoint[this.$route.params.id] = this.page
localStorage.setItem('checkpoint', JSON.stringify(checkpoint))
```

I suppose the correct process would start reading the current checkpoint from local storage.

Because of issue #887, it is hard to show this behavior directly in annotation page.
However... you can inspect local storage using your browser as you can see in the following video:

![checkpoint-issue](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/24196899/87235717-473e8d00-c3b5-11ea-85e4-51fc9df71816.gif)

Your Environment
---------
*   Using Docker with docker-compose -f docker-compose.dev.yml up -d
*   Original code from doccano/master on July 10, 2020, commit 690b688

I will submit a pull request as a proposed solution.

title: Nonworking delete button is shown for labels of other users
body:
In projects with shared annotations, labels from other users are shown with a delete button next to them. However normal users (not annotation approvers) cannot delete labels of other users. Trying to delete one causes a 403 error.

It would be good to hide the delete button for these labels or at least have a visual aid to distinguish between own and foreign labels.


How to reproduce the behaviour
---------
* Create project with shared annotations (text classification in my case)
* Let one user annotate the dataset
* Second user sees labels of first user with a delete button
* Clicking delete causes a 403 error

title: How to upload a document with annotation from doccano API
body:
Some context:
DoccanoDocumentDTO.py
```
from pydantic import BaseModel
class DoccanoAnnotationDTO(BaseModel):
    id: Optional[int]
    prob: int = 0
    label: int
    start_offset: int
    end_offset: int
    user: Optional[int]
    document: Optional[int]

class DoccanoDocumentDTO(BaseModel):
    id: Optional[int]
    text: str
    annotations: List[DoccanoAnnotationDTO]
    meta: str = "{}"
    annotation_approver: Optional[str]
```

DoccanoClient.py
```    
def insert_new_document(
    self, document: DoccanoDocumentDTO, project_id: int
) -> DoccanoDocumentDTO:
    url = self.doccano_url + f"/projects/{project_id}/docs"  
    posted_document = self._request_url(
        "POST", url, data=document.dict(), headers=self.headers
    ).json()

    return DoccanoDocumentDTO(**posted_document)
```

When building a DoccanoDocumentDTO and sending to API, it receives and uploads document, without any annotations. 

In doccano api, when using `<localhost>:<port>/v1/projects/{project_id}/docs/{doc_id}` endpoint, is possible to see that annotations is expected to be `string`, but when returning an annotated document, it comes a list as my dto suggests.

![Captura de Tela 2020-06-19 às 19 32 22](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/42852567/85183862-c4b62800-b263-11ea-8144-0645411d5eab.png)

title: [Bug report] Click outside a dialog/press Esc and you'll break The World

How to reproduce the behaviour
---------
1. Go to some page. Say Dataset page.
2. Open a dialog. Say "Actions -> Import Dataset" dialog.
3. Click outside of the dialog OR press Esc key.

Now:

title: [Bug report] Annotator doesn't see the project
body:
How to reproduce the behaviour
---------
I saw a situation: user `a_user` is an `annotator` at `a_project`'s Members page; but `a_user` doesn't see `a_project` at his Projects page.

At that moment I've removed `a_user`'s role and added it again (since situation has been seen during my job process so I had to solve it). It helped.

But I reproduced it synthetically:
1. Add `a_user` as an `annotator` of `a_project`.
2. Sign in to Django Admin.
3. Go to `Projects` page.
4. Go to `a_project`'s page.
5. On `Users` field, deselect `a_user` item.
6. Click `Save`.

Now:  _user `a_user` is an `annotator` at `a_project`'s Members page; but `a_user` doesn't see `a_project` at his Projects page_.

**Questions:**
1. Where and how is list from p.5 stored?
2. How does result of pp.1-6 could be reached by interaction with doccano, what do you think?

title: Execute refresh above the pagination-boundary example causes miss ordering
body:
How to reproduce the issue:
Scroll on any project with more than 10 documents (pagination limit) and hit shift+refresh. Upon reloading, instead of getting document ID (24 for example) will get the corresponding document on the first page, in this case, 4. 
This can be assessed with a print in store/documents.js, in the getDocumentList action, line 102, (console.log(payload)). 
I've been able to fix this by adding this.updateSearchOptions before this.getDocumentList in the BottomNavigator.vue. 

I don't know if this is of any help to you but it might so i'll leave it here.

title: On first docker build: core-js not found
body:
I wanted to deploy Doccano on our own platform but I ran into an issue. Building doccano with docker-compose, both with .prod and .dev yaml files, fails on the frontend image. The issue here looks like there's a npm dependency missing.
Inspecting the logs from the dev compose file:
```
✔ Client: Compiled with some errors in 18.89s

 ERROR  Failed to compile with 145 errors

These dependencies were not found:
* core-js/modules/es6.array.find in ./.nuxt/client.js, ./node_modules/babel-loader/lib??ref--2-0!./node_modules/vue-loader/lib??vue-loader-options!./components/containers/annotation/TextClassification.vue?vue&type=script&lang=js& and 2 others
[...long list of dependencies]
```

The containers starts but when accessing the frontend page at localhost:3000 I got a long list of errors:
```
ERROR in ./.nuxt/client.js
Module not found: Error: Can't resolve 'core-js/modules/es6.array.find' in '/src/frontend/.nuxt'
[...]
```

Running compose with prod.yaml stops with a long list of errors that look really the same issue:
```
ERROR in ./components/containers/annotation/TextClassification.vue?vue&type=script&lang=js& (./node_modules/babel-loader/lib??ref--2-0!./node_modules/vuetify-loader/lib/loader.js??ref--17-0!./node_modules/vue-loader/lib??vue-loader-options!./components/containers/annotation/TextClassification.vue?vue&type=script&lang=js&)
[...]
```

Manually installing core-js did not solved the problem.
```bash
cd frontend
npm install --save core-js
```

I noticed that the `package-lock.json` file is not commited: for what I know it should be committed to "pin" each package to an exact version, allowing reproducibile builds.

How to reproduce the problem
---------
```bash
docker-compose -f docker-compose.dev.yml up -d 
```

Your Environment
---------
*   Operating System: docker on macos
*   Python Version Used: 3.6
*   Doccano master@4378b87 (10th may 2020)
*   How did you install doccano (Heroku button etc): docker-compose (dev)

title: Encoding issue with /docs/download?q=json API
body:
I've been working with documents that contain utf-8 characters like `Dear\u00a0John`. When reading this back out via the `v1/projects/{project id}/docs/download?q=json` API, it becomes this: `DearÂ John`. The extra character means that every sequence annotation after this point is incorrect, because the character offsets are shifted by 1.

If I instead hit the document detail API `v1/projects/{project id}/docs/{doc_id}`, the text comes back the same as it was uploaded.
Another workaround for this particular example is post-processing by doing `str(bytes(text, encoding='iso-8859-1'), encoding='utf-8')`, but for other characters like `Nationâ€™s Hospital` this does not work.

Should the download API responses be utf-8 encoded like the single doc API?

    Operating System: mac os
    Python Version Used: 3.7
    When you install doccano: Feb 6 '20
    How did you install doccano (Heroku button etc): docker-compose

title: annotations are misplaced / text wrapping in sequence annotation interface
body:
### Unexpected behaviour

The lines and labelled entities are flying around out of their order, and the text appears messed up 

### with annotations

### How to reproduce the behaviour

```
docker container start doccano
```

Assessment and Recommendation

Ms. ___ is a 47 year old African American woman with Crohn’s disease, HTN, and DM who  presented to the ER after two days of acute abdominal pain, nausea, vomiting, and diarrhea most  likely due to Crohn’s disease exacerbation.

#1 Crohn’s exacerbation (abdominal pain with nausea, vomiting, and diarrhea)
Ms.  ___  presented  with  acute  diffuse  abdominal  pain  that  was  followed  by  nausea,  vomiting, and diarrhea.  The pain  was much more intense than the chronic pain she usually  experiences with her Crohn’s disease. The differential diagnosis for her cluster of symptoms  includes  inflammatory  bowel  disease,  specifically  a  Crohn’s  disease  exacerbation,  intestinal  obstruction, and mesenteric insufficiency or infarction. Ms. ___’s abdominal pain is most likely  from a Crohn’s disease flare because of her presenting symptoms, radiological imaging findings,  and history of these exacerbations that have resolved with the use of prednisone. Crohn’s disease  is an inflammatory bowel disease condition of unknown etiology that can affect any part of the  GI tract. Its primary characteristic is transmural inflammation that can affect the GI tract from  mouth to anus and can result in severe abdominal pain, bleeding, ileitis, colitis, bowel perforation  and fistula formation, and perianal abscesses. 80% of patients have small bowel involvement,  including the distal ileum with possible sparing of the rectum. Patients with Crohn’s disease can  be asymptomatic at times but when the disease is exacerbated, patients can present with weight  loss, fever, nausea, abdominal pain, diarrhea, and anal bleeding. Crohn’s disease is diagnosed by  colonoscopy and intestinal biopsy. Pathologically, Crohn’s disease is noted for its cobblestone  appearance  from  polypoidy  mucosal  changes  and  focal  areas  of  ulceration  next  to  normal  mucosa.  Crohn’s differs from another inflammatory bowel disease ulcerative colitis (UC) in that  UC has a continuous area of inflammation to the level of the submucosa that begins at the rectum  and works up backwards up the GI tract, rarely forms fistulas or perforations, and has a higher  association with colon cancer. There are also extraintestinal manifestations of Crohn’s disease,  including eye involvement (uveitis, iritis, and episcleritis), skin disorders (erythema nodosum  and  pyoderma  gangrenosum),  arthritis  of  large  joints  or  sacroilitis,  primary  sclerosing  cholangitis, secondary amyloidosis, and venous or arterial thromboembolism. Ms. ___’s medical  history indicates that she has debilitating knee arthritis and back pain and developed a DVT in  2001 that resulted in a PE. These other disease manifestations may be associated to her Crohn’s  disease.  As in Ms. ___’s case, abdominal imaging can detect active Crohn’s disease and its  inflammatory  process.  Crohn’s  disease  can  be  treated  with  numerous  medications  that  play  primarily a role in immunosuppression. These medications in order of importance include 5- ASA  drugs  (sulfasalazine  and  mesalamine),  steroids  (prednisone  or  budesonide),  immunosuppressive agents (azathioprine, 6-mercaptopurine, methotrexate), immune modulators  (infliximab,    adalimumab)  omega  3-  acid  supplements,  and  antibiotics  when  warranted.  A  combination  of  these  medications  can  be  used  to  control  the  disease  and  prevent  Crohn’s  exacerbation  but  corticosteroids  have  been  found  to  give  the  most  immediate  relief  from  inflammation.

For her Crohn's flare, Ms. ___ will start prednisone 60 mg and take the medication for two weeks and then slowly taper herself every two weeks decreasing the dosage by 10 mg.  The  vomiting and diarrhea had resolved by admission and her nausea will be treated with phenegran  if it persists. An erythrocyte sedimentation rate will also be obtained to see if there is an increase  in inflammation and possible infection process.  Ms. ___ will also continue taking her other  medications for Crohn’s:  mercaptopurine, mesalamine, and omega 3-acid supplement.

A  small  bowel  obstruction  is  also  on  the  differential  and  occurs  when  the  passage  of  normal GI contents is blocked. This usually occurs as a result of post-operative complications or  hernias but can be due to masses, strictures, gastroparesis, or simply constipation. This ileus  would present with abdominal pain and bloating, nausea, vomiting, and constipation, a reduced  appetite due to a feeling of fullness, and abdominal distention. However, Ms. ___ was able to  pass stool with the onset of her symptoms and was not constipated or abnormally distended,  which would be expected in an intestinal obstruction.  It is also unlikely that a  small bowel  obstruction would present with guaiac positive stool. Furthermore, while the abdominal XR did  show dilated small bowel loops that are seen in a small bowel obstruction, the CT image better  identified this as thickening of the terminal mucosal ileum, which is more suggestive of Crohn’s  disease  than  a  small  bowel  obstruction.  Also,  the  acute  nausea  and  vomiting  resolved  spontaneously by the time of admission. A small bowel obstruction can be a medical emergency  and should be diagnosed quickly to prevent complications, such as ischemia and strangulation of  intestines. Medical management for small bowel includes mobilizing the patient, discontinuing  medications that may have reduced gut motility, enemas, decompression with NGT, rectal tubes,  or colonoscopy, or operative procedure if the condition merits it.

Acute  mesenteric  ischemia  of  the  small  intestine  is  on  the  differential  for  Ms.  ___’s  abdominal pain. Mesenteric ischemia occurs when there is a reduction in arterial or venous  intestinal blood flow due to an occlusion, vasospasm, and/or hypoperfusion of the mesenteric  vasculature.  Mesenteric  ischemia  can  result  in  bowel  infarction,  sepsis,  and  is  a  medical  emergency.  The four major causes of acute mesenteric ischemia are superior mesenteric artery  embolism  or  thrombosis,  mesenteric  venous  thrombosis,  and  nonocclusive  ischemia.  Most  mesenteric ischemia is of arterial origin. The patient usually presents with rapid onset of severe  periumbilical abdominal pain that is out of proportion to physical exam findings in addition to  nausea and vomiting. Sudden pain associated with minimal abdominal signs and forceful bowel  evacuation increase the likelihood of mesenteric ischemia. Also, a state of metabolic acidosis and  acute abdominal pain also suggest mesenteric ischemia. Ms. ___’s risk factors for mesenteric  ischemia include hypercoagulability, specifically her DVT resulting in PE in 2001. Also, Ms.  ___  has  a  history  of  small  bowel  obstruction,  which  can  predispose  an  individual  to  hypoperfusion  leading  to  ischemia.    Mesenteric  angiography  is  used  to  detect  mesenteric  ischemia and Doppler ultrasound can help visualize occlusions and stenoses of vessels.  A CT  scan can be helpful in detecting a mesenteric thrombosis. Labs to consider are lactic acid levels  and CBC for leukocytosis and elevated hematocrit, even though these studies are nonspecific.  While she experienced nausea and vomiting with her abdominal pain, Ms. ___’s abdominal pain  is unlikely to be from acute mesenteric ischemia because of the duration of her abdominal pain,  normal vital signs and physical exam that was not out of proportion in regards to her appearance. 

#2 DM

Ms. ___ is a diabetic and her glucose on admission was 91. Her glucose will be strictly  monitored during her stay and her AIC will be checked. She has been on a combination of  Sitalgliptin  and  metformin  to  treat  her  insulin  resistance  diabetes.  Sitalgliptin  is  a  DPP-4  inhibitor that improves glycemic control by increasing the amount of glucagon-like peptide -1  and  gastric  inhibitory  polypeptide  secretion,  leading  to  increased  secretion  of  insulin  and  inhibition  of  glucagon  secretion.    Metformin  is  a  biguanide  that  reduces  hepatic  glucose  production, therefore also lowering glucotoxicity. We do not have this combination medication  and will start Ms. ___ on sliding scale insulin to control her glucose levels.

#3 HTN

Ms.  ___  has  hypertension  that  appears  to  be  well  controlled  on  lisinopril.  Her  hypertension,  DM,  and  physical  inactivity  are  major  cardiovascular  risk  factors  and  it  is  important to keep her blood pressure well-controlled under 130/80 to prevent end-organ damage  and  future  cardiovascular  and  cerebrovascular  events.  We  will  continue  her  lisinopril  as  prescribed.

#4 Nicotine dependence

Ms. ___ has smoked at least half a pack of cigarettes for the past 30 years. Smoking toxins  can exacerbate Crohn’s and cause more active episodes of inflammation. She will be counseled  on  the  importance  of  smoking  cessation  and  the  effects  it  has  on  her  cardiovascular  and  pulmonary health, risk of cancer development, and current Crohn’s disease condition.

title: Can't handle real enter event
body:
How to reproduce the behaviour
---------

When I use a Japanese IME in a sequence to sequence project, pressing the enter button will call the submit function. But this is not an intended behavior.

![doccano_bug.gif](https://qiita-image-store.s3.ap-northeast-1.amazonaws.com/0/77079/56b12a88-5c34-ff0b-75ea-5d378197af56.gif)

Your Environment
---------
<!-- Include details of your environment.-->
*   Operating System: macOS Mojave
*   Python Version Used: 3.6
*   When you install doccano: master branch(2020/03/23)
*   How did you install doccano (Heroku button etc): from source

title: [Major Bug] Two annotators cannot select the same label in document classification task
body:
How to reproduce the behaviour
---------
<!-- Before submitting an issue, make sure to check the docs and closed issues and FAQ to see if any of the solutions work for you. https://github.com/doccano/doccano/wiki/Frequently-Asked-Questions -->

<!-- Include a code example or the steps that led to the problem. Please try to be as specific as possible. -->

Your Environment
---------
<!-- Include details of your environment.-->
*   Operating System: python3.6-slim docker image, host OS is ubuntu 16.04
*   Python Version Used: 3.6
*   When you install doccano: March 10, 2020
*   How did you install doccano: git clone and then docker-compose -f docker-compose.prod.yml up


Hello, I have been testing the current version for document classification with multiple annotators. I found out that for a given row, two annotators are unable to select the same label. 

If annotator A selects label A for a row, annotator B is unable to do so. 

I get the following error:
Error: Request failed with status code 500

I hope this bug can be fixed.

title: Regression - data import from cloud
body:
How to reproduce the behaviour
---------
Go to the data import page. There isn't a way to import via the cloud, as there was in #213 

Your Environment
---------
Latest docker build of Doccano (prod and dev)

Am I overlooking something, or has the button for cloud uploading (introduced in #213, requested in #141) gone missing since the move to vuetify?

title: AWS Launch Stack Button Needs Updating
body:
<!-- Include details of your environment.-->
*   How did you install doccano (Heroku button etc): doccano AWS button.

The AWS button links to an [older version](https://s3-external-1.amazonaws.com/cf-templates-10vry9l3mp71r-us-east-1/2019290i9t-AppSGl1poo4j8qpq) of the CF stack that references `chakki-works/doccano`, compared to the current AWS deploy config [on the repo](https://github.com/doccano/doccano/blob/master/awsdeploy.yml).

title: Frontend failed to build
body:
How to reproduce the behaviour
---------
<!-- Before submitting an issue, make sure to check the docs and closed issues and FAQ to see if any of the solutions work for you. https://github.com/doccano/doccano/wiki/Frequently-Asked-Questions -->

<!-- Include a code example or the steps that led to the problem. Please try to be as specific as possible. -->
I run 
`
sudo docker-compose -f docker-copose.prod.yml up 
`
i got this error 
ERROR: Service 'frontend' failed to build: The command '/bin/sh -c npm run build' returned a non-zero code: 1
so after i was change node version in frontend/Dockerfile file from 13.2 to 13.6 and then go out of doccano folder and then run prune volumes with this command 

`
sudo docker system prune -a --volumes
`

and again run 
`
sudo docker-compose -f docker-compose.prod.yml up
` 

command but i got still same error . Please tell me what i have to do now to fix this error.

Your Environment
---------
<!-- Include details of your environment.-->
*   Operating System:18.04
*   Python Version Used:3.6
*   When you install doccano: one  month back
*   How did you install doccano (Heroku button etc): git clone + docker-compose

title: 'front' service build failed after docker-compose + impossible to pull doccano >= 1.0.0

labels.name: duplicate
labels.description: This issue or pull request already exists

body:
Hello,

I have been using Doccano consistently but I wanted to try the new interface that appeared with v1.0.0. I tried to pull v1.0.2, v1.0.1, v1.0.0 but I always get the "old" user interface and none of the features announced (Dark Mode, new beautiful interface).

I also tried to pull git repo and run the docker-compose but the "front" service build failed. 
Here is the output

Can you guide me please ? Thank you in advance.
[failed_build.log](https://github.com/doccano/doccano/files/4295550/failed_build.log)

Config
- MacOS Catalina
- Docker Desktop v2.2
- Compose v1.25.2

title: Documents jump out of order in sequence annotation project
body:
How to reproduce the behaviour
---------
When clicking through documents to label, or using the arrow keys, sometimes documents jump out of order. The page indicator on the upper right corner only increments by one item at a time. 

[Here is a video that might make this more clear](https://michaelmisiewicz.com/stuff/doccano_pagination_bug_demo.mov). The bug first occurs at 0:08 and I am able to cause it again a few times. 

There are no obvious errors in the browser console or logs from Nginx or Django that appear to explain it.

Behavior appears to occur both in Safari and Chrome on Mac. I have observed it occurring around the transition from 10-11 which makes it seem like a pagination bug, but possibly it occurs elsewhere in sequence of documents (e.g. 145 to 146) as well. 

Your Environment
---------
*   Operating System:
CentOS 7.5 on AWS, running Docker 18.06.1-ce, build e68fc7a
*   Python Version Used:
According to `Dockerfile`, 3.6.
*   When you install doccano:
Today, from HEAD
*   How did you install doccano (Heroku button etc):
Docker compose. i.e.: `docker-compose -f docker-compose.prod.yml up -d`.

title: Authorized project user can access the individual project page (/projects/x/) but the projects page (/projects)
body:
If you open a GitHub issue, here is our policy:

1. It must be a bug, a feature request, or a significant problem with documentation (for small docs fixes please send a PR instead).
2. The form below must be filled out.

------------------------

### System information
- **OS Platform and Distribution (e.g., Linux Ubuntu 16.04)**: Mac OSX 10.14.6
- **Python version**: 3.7.5

### Describe the problem
Describe the problem clearly here. Be sure to convey here why it's a bug or a feature request.

I am trying to use doccano to enable group collaboration on a text classification task. However when I create new users and give them permissions to said project, the new users do not seem to have access to the project on the home page.

See the attached: I created a new user test, gave the user superuser status, see that the user appears on all projects as a  user (within the django admin interface), login to doccano under this username, but see that no projects appear under http://0.0.0.0:8000/projects/. 

However, I noted that the project in question is referred to by the underlying file structure as "projects/6/" and therefore when I navigate to http://0.0.0.0:8000/projects/6/ I am able to access the content of said project.

It is as if the django web server is not properly sync'd with the underlying postgres database where all these data live (I'm guessing...I'm a total newbie).

title: Delete the last data in the last page will lead to 404 page.
body:
How to reproduce the behaviour
---------
<!-- Before submitting an issue, make sure to check the docs and closed issues and FAQ to see if any of the solutions work for you. https://github.com/chakki-works/doccano/wiki/Frequently-Asked-Questions -->
This is not a big defect, but it should be easily fixed.
I uploaded a lot of data in dataset page, started to delete all data from back. When I deleted the only last data in the last page, it lead me to the 404 page. It can be more friendly if return the page before the last page when I delete the last data in the last page.
<!-- Include a code example or the steps that led to the problem. Please try to be as specific as possible. -->

Your Environment
---------
<!-- Include details of your environment.-->
*   Operating System: Archlinux
*   Python Version Used: not sure which version the python is in the docker container.
*   When you install doccano: Now
*   How did you install doccano (Heroku button etc): docker

title: Strange redirect

labels.name: duplicate
labels.description: This issue or pull request already exists

body:
I noticed some strange behavior debugging #554 issue. So:

1. Reproduce conditions of #554 issue.
2. Go to `http://<ip address>:<port>/projects`.
3. Yo get `window.alert()` with 500 error message.
4. Press <F5>.
5. You are redirected to `http://<ip address>/projects` (without `<port>`!). Why?

P.S. I don't get this redirection without #554 conditions (i.e. without 500 error).

title: Mouse selection of first words in row fail to tag until after another selection is made
body:
How to reproduce the behavior
---------
- When on a new sentence or example, if the first thing you tag is the first word of a row, it will fail to annotate the label if you select to the left of the first letter with your mouse and drag the highlight to the right. Once the word is highlighted in the way, if you click on any label it will not assign the label and it will deselect you selection. 

- This can be seen in the DEMO on your website: https://doccano.herokuapp.com/demo/named-entity-recognition/#
- happens in both Chrome and Edge

- You can select a single word or multiple, in either case this will fail occasionally (probably 5 in 10 times). 
- moving your selector from right to left also fails to tag occasionally. 
1. Go into the live demo on the site, select the "The Democratic Party is one of the two major contemporary po..." example
2. Select the 3rd row "Republican" text by starting the click before the "R" and ending at the completion of the word
3. Select the "Person" tag
4. If this did actually annotate the word Republican as person, do not refresh the page but try again with the word "Republican" in the 2nd row, this should word but then when you select the word "the" in the second row and try to assign it to the tag "Person", this should fail

- double clicking seems to mostly work but does also fail 
1. Go into the live demo on the site, select the "The Democratic Party is one of the two major contemporary po..." example
2. Select the 3rd row "Republican" text by double clicking the word
3. Select the "Event" tag, this should work
4. select 2nd row "Republican" by double clicking
5. Select the "Event" tag, this should work
6. now select the word "the" in the 2nd row by double clicking
7. try to assign it the tag of "Event" and this should fail

Your Environment
---------
- LIVE DEMO page on Doccano website
- also saw failures with personal data, Docker load, V1.0.2

title: Can't login from the project link
body:
1. Open browser(not logged in) and go to project link. 

for example: [http://IP:9740/projects/6](http://IP:9740/projects/6)

2. Log in with correct password

3. Incorrect pass msg will be show.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/43772748/72784912-441bdd00-3c6d-11ea-8bc1-3f0d7dabca72.png)

Your Environment
---------
Doccano lastest code of master branch.

title: docker-compose error - nuxt

labels.name: duplicate
labels.description: This issue or pull request already exists

body:
If you open a GitHub issue, here is our policy:

1. It must be a bug, a feature request, or a significant problem with documentation (for small docs fixes please send a PR instead).
2. The form below must be filled out.

------------------------

### System information
- **OS Platform and Distribution (e.g., Linux Ubuntu 16.04)**:
Windows 10
- **Python version**: 
3.7.4

### Describe the problem
Docker compose doesn't work. It fails on nuxt build. Has anyone else had this issue? 
I've tried tweaking my docker configs but no luck.

- Increased docker memory to 8192
- Increased swap to 2048

`ERROR in ./.nuxt/client.js

title: Documentation: wrong port
body:
in [FAQ](https://github.com/doccano/doccano/wiki/Frequently-Asked-Questions#i-want-to-add-annotators):

```
2. Use docker
...
Create & Run doccano container: docker run -d --name doccano -p 8000:80 chakkiworks/doccano
```

which fails, because the port within the container is 8000. It must read:

`docker run -d --name doccano -p 8000:8000 chakkiworks/doccano`

title: Unable to login after one click deployment on AWS
body:
Unable to login(Your username and password didn't match. Please try again.) after one-click deployment on AWS. 

I was not able to login with the AdminUserName and AdminPassword set during the CloudFormation stack setup.

When I ssh into the EC2 instance, the values were not set for $ADMIN $PASSWORD $EMAIL. I had to run `source /env.list` to set the values and then run `sudo docker exec doccano tools/create-admin.sh ${ADMIN} ${EMAIL}  ${PASSWORD}` in order to set the desired login ID/PASSWORD.

Regards
Akhil Negi

title: Invalid "Annotate" button redirection
body:
<!-- Before submitting an issue, make sure to check the docs and closed issues and FAQ to see if any of the solutions work for you. https://github.com/chakki-works/doccano/wiki/Frequently-Asked-Questions -->

<!-- Include a code example or the steps that led to the problem. Please try to be as specific as possible. -->

<!-- Include details of your environment.-->

The "Annotate" button on an individual list item is supposed to open that particular record to annotate but it is opening any random record.

Observation: If the displaying list is of size 10, then it opens the 10th index and if the size is 100, then it opens the 100th index irrespective of your selected("clicked") sample.

How to reproduce the behaviour
---------
1. load more than 100 records 
2. goto dataset and change the list size from 10 to 100 
3. click on > to load different records on the list
4. click on "Annotate" 
5. it will open 100th record irrespective of chosen one.

title: Wrong highlighting when there are overlapping entities in the source data
body:
Hi everyone. 
I have some french data which are already annotated and which I would like an annotator to check, but this data have overlapping entities. For example:
```json
{
	"text": "Les obligations en matière d’autorisation pour les sources de rayonnements ionisants sont définies dans la norme CNEN NE 6.02 . Celle ci classe les sources de rayonnement en 10 catégories : les groupes I à III couvrent les sources scellées , les groupes IV à VIII les sources non scellées de différents types et les groupes IX et X les installations qui utilisent des accélérateurs de particules .", 
	"labels": [
		[62, 84, "11 Occupational Health"], 
		[62, 73, "11 Occupational Health"], 
		[159, 170, "11 Occupational Health"]
	]
}
```
So, the first entity is `"rayonnements ionisants"` and the second one is `"rayonnement"`. The problem is that when I try to highlight an entity after these overlapping entities I higlight totally incorrect words. For example, I tried to highlight `dans la norme` but it highligted `6.02 . Celle` (see gif below).
![bug](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/32651336/69724933-09df0500-112e-11ea-85aa-1106940697b1.gif)

Moreover, you can see that it duplicates `"rayonnements ionisants"` because of overlapping entities. I suppose that's why it highlights wrong words.

title: No project listed in the projects page | 404 Error
body:
Hello everyone.
First I've tried to use the newest version of doccano using the docker. It appeared to be fine, none of the users, even Admin could reach the projects page, though. There was always 404 error. Well, when the admin creates the project on the web interface, it appears until the next log in. Then the page again could not be found (404 error) 
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/51916323/69699433-f1a0c300-10f8-11ea-83b4-50f9ac4f5489.png)
So, due to that, the decision to use an older version of doccano was made. 
It was compiled from the binaries. Everything seemed to be fine, except for no role were available. So I created two roles (the spelling really matters, otherwise nothing will work). But as soon as I did it, admin no longer can see any of the projects on the web interface (I even tried to create the other user with admin privileges, the same thing). So I have to put the url myself, which is not comfortable.. At least, I cannot see the name of the project, so have to memorize the project id..
One more thing to mention, now admin is never greeted by the web interface with it's name. on the name spot just space. I guess it actually the main problem here since the user with such a name naturally is not allowed to view projects.
![Сни22мок](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/51916323/69700139-c919c880-10fa-11ea-8476-59b14045ece7.JPG)

Any ideas on how to solve it?
Thank you a lot.

title: Hard Coded AMI Id in cloudformation template fails
body:
How to reproduce the behaviour
---------
I copied the AWS cloudformation template from the repo and tried to deploy it to my AWS account. It failed because it could not find the AMI.

Your Environment
---------

I am in the ap-east-1 region. This is important because AMIs are local to a region. But I suspect the ami not even exist anymore. Has anyone else tried to deploy the cfn template recently?

Suggestion
---------

Consider using something like this:
https://aws.amazon.com/blogs/compute/query-for-the-latest-amazon-linux-ami-ids-using-aws-systems-manager-parameter-store/

Also, it was doubly frustrating because I could not easily find anywhere in the documentation what image it was using. Just the non-existent AMI id. So I had to guess that you were using ubuntu 16.

title: Can't change label after assigning the shortcut key
body:
Thank you for the work you put into this amazing tool.
I have trouble when trying to rename the labels or changing the colors when they have a shortcut key assigned. 

How to reproduce the behavior:
Create a label, for instance "label_1", and assign a shortcut key to it.

Once the label is created, click on "Edit" and try to change the color. The message "You cannot use same label name or shortcut key." will then appear.

The same issue happens if you want to rename the label. For instance, try to rename the label to "Label_1" with a capital letter, and the same error message will appear.


To avoid this issue, I have to assign an unused shortcut key to the label while I change its name and color, validate, and then change the shortcut key back to the one I want to use.

**System Information**

*   Operating System: Windows 10
*   Installed on Heroku with the Heroku button.

title: No response after attempting to upload file
body:
I was trying to upload the following document to a project. The uploader recognizes the file name but fails to upload the data to the project. The portal does not issue any error messages either. No issues on the heroku log as well.Are there any other constraints that I should be aware about?  

`{"text": " Background: Ebola is a virus that has infected and killed people mostly in West Africa. There is no treatment or prevention for it, but several drugs are being studied. Researchers want to test the drug MAb114 in healthy people not exposed to Ebola to see whether it can be used for Ebola treatment in people who are infected in the future. This trial will not expose volunteers to the Ebola virus. Objectives: To see if MAb114 is safe and how a person's body responds to it. Eligibility: Healthy adults ages 18-60 who weigh 220.5 pounds or less Design: Participants will be screened under protocol NIH 11-I-0164 with:   -  Medical history   -  Physical exam   -  Blood or urine tests Participants will have a first 8- to10-hour visit. They will get MAb114 by IV infusion. For this, a thin tube will be placed in an arm vein. They may get an IV line in their other arm to collect blood. Blood will be taken many times before and after the infusion. Participants may have a urine test. Participants will get a thermometer to check their temperature for 3 days after they get MAb114. They will record their highest temperature and any symptoms. Participants will have about 14 more study visits over 6 months. At each visit, they will have blood taken and be checked for any health changes. They will talk about how they are feeling and if they have taken any medications. At the end of the 6 months, participants may be invited to take part in another study for follow-up sample collection. title: Heroku postdeploy execution timed out
body:
### System information
- **OS Platform and Distribution (e.g., Linux Ubuntu 16.04)**:
Heroku via https://dashboard.heroku.com/new?template=https://github.com/chakki-works/doccano/
- **Python version**: 
3.6

### Describe the problem
Deploying a new Heroku app with https://dashboard.heroku.com/new?template=https://github.com/chakki-works/doccano/ is failing on the 'Run scripts & scale dynos' step.
